definition: to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point

sentences.english: People often build their identity around their defects.
sentences.chinese: 人往往将自我的身分建立在他们的短处上。

sentences.english: Gollan believes this deficit can becompensated for with extra study.
sentences.chinese: 高兰认为这个短处可以通过额外学习的方式来补足。

sentences.english: Every archetype has strengths, weaknesses, gifts, and fears.
sentences.chinese: 每一个原型都有自己的长处，短处，天性，和恐惧。

sentences.english: Pluses and minuses to both vehicles but I am attracted by the more luxurious interior of the QX.
sentences.chinese: 两个长处和短处车，但我吸引更豪华的室内QX。

sentences.english: Howells is fully aware of Bartley's failings.
sentences.chinese: 豪威尔斯是完全清楚巴特勒的短处的。

sentences.english: Professor Weinberger recognizes the strengths and weaknesses of his site.
sentences.chinese: 温伯格教授承认，他的网站的长处和短处。

sentences.english: As far as I am concerned, the advantages mentioned above exceed the disadvantages.
sentences.chinese: 至于我的看法是，上面提到的长处超过短处。

sentences.english: She likes to show people up in public.
sentences.chinese: 她喜欢在众人前揭人的短处。

sentences.english: What are your strengths and weaknesses in hiring?
sentences.chinese: 在聘用方面，你的长处和短处分别是什么？

definition: lit. for some things a foot may be too short, and for the other an inch will suffice (proverb)/fig. everyone has their strong and weak points/everything has its advantages and disadvantages
pinyin: chi3 you3 suo3 duan3 , cun4 you3 suo3 chang2

definition: nobody is perfect/everyone has their defect
to belittle/to disparage/to play down/to demean/to degrade/to devalue
not all gold is sufficiently red (idiom); no-one is perfect
to be unduly humble (idiom)/to undervalue oneself
